title: Drawing, "Coat of arms"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. An escutcheon with a crown on top, above two crossed branches with a mask above the crossing point. Two angels flow beside it, the left one blowing the trumpet, the right one raising the trumpet with his left hand, supporting the crown with his right one. Usual background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Coat of arms".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1825.
